page.title: 03Birds - Migrants & Nesting
page.content: Birds - Migrants & Nesting By April 3, chiffchaffs and willow warblers arrived, the former not remaining. Fewer willow warblers raised young. House martins did not use all original nest-sites but some raised second broods after failure of the first. By April 25, blackcaps, whitethroat, cuckoo, yellow wagtails and spotted flycatchers had returned and winter flocks of linnets, green and goldfinches and skylarks had separated to breed. The cold spring and wet early summer continued tp affect migrants adversely. A wood warbler survey from May l5 to June lO in local woods gave negative results although other warblers were seen. By June 2 more swifts than usual arrived but did not nest.
